runs.comm: Smith back, dropped into the leg side and a quick run, disproportionate cheers
shortish and Jean-Paul Duminy back and defends to point
Duminy beaten, it smacks him on the pads, a loud appeal but it pitched well outside the leg stump
more cheers as Anderson loses his line and sends down a big off-side wide
identikit ball, more semi-mocking cheers and Anderson looks miffed
it spits off a length and catches Duminy in no-man's land, the ball scoots behind square on the off
leg-side, Smith eases it off his hips and the ball shoots away, much to fine for deep square leg to get anything on it
full, the ball lifts and Smith shoulders arms as the ball is taken by Prior at head height
what a start, super delivery, on a length it seamed away and then swung back in,  Duminy played a nothing shot and a thin edge was taken by Prior
outside off, de Villiers leaves
outside off once more -  84mph - and de Villiers again adopts a watching brief
seconds ... half volley which de Villiers creams between cover and extra cover
Broad drops slightly short and de Villiers leans back and heaves that over midwicket ...a  one-bounce four. The crowd goes wild.
fuller, inside edge down to fine leg where Anderson does the business
a peach, slightly short and the ball snorts and leaves Smith flailing
lovely placement, whipped off his hips and again it beats the man at square leg
turned off middle-and-leg to Mascarenhas who had moved finer after the last four
more bounce from Flintoff, the ball leaps and de Villiers can only spar at it
outside off and de Villiers leaves
dug in, de Villiers plays a whirling pull but is too early and the ball goes through to Prior
half volley driven to Mascarenhas at mid-on
Smith drives again but with much more bottom hand and that takes it between midwicket and mid-on. Ugly but effective
back of a length, Smith surprised and he jumps as he blocks
same length, Smith rocks back and looks to cut but it's too close to get away with that
wide half-volley, smashed through the covers, lovely shot and that flew to the rope
slightly short, Smith heaves that into the on side where the man at deep  backward square leg fields
leg side, Smith shapes to swish it off his hips but misses
Smith tries to pull but gets a massive top edge, the ball swirls in the twilight, Prior leaves it to Mascarenhas at long leg and he takes it with no alarms
outside off stump at 82mph, de Villiers, who is either cautious or utterly carefree with little in between, leaves
loose drive, a thick edge and that scurries away for four
another flashing drive but nowhere near the ball
half volley and driven through extra cover, a lovely stroke and he really middled that ... he couldn;t have asked for Broad to give him one more in the slot
slower ball, de Villiers misses, Broad start to run for the ball as it bobbles into the leg side, decides to appeal and falls over mid-pitch in the confusion
another loose drive from de Villiers but this time he only succeeds in getting a thin edge and Prior leaps around like Zeberdee as he takes the catch
pushed jerkily into the on side
left alone as Flintoff probes just outside off stump. "God wheels," observes Andrew Miller
straight, quick and blocked ... Flintoff quickly through in his follow through to field
back of a length, seamed into the batsman and he can only fend it a few yards down the pitch, Flintoff fields once more
fuller, Kemp flicks to mid-on
fractionally short, Boucher stands tall but can only push to point
no foot movement, a spar and Boucher misses
pulled from outside off stump, didn't seem to be timed but it raced away
push and run to Snape at extra cover, well stopped but good running between the wickets
short, no timing in the pull and the ball apologetically wheezes about two-thirds of the way to the boundary, well picked up and only the one
beaten by movement away off the seam
defended to cover
neatly picked up off middle, swished over wide mid-on, Anderson fields on the rope
full, no more than defended to mid-on who makes a complete sow's ear of stopping it and it goes through his legs
wide  would have been had he left it - slammed to mid-off
he drives, he misses and Prior, standing up,  takes
back and steered to the left of wide mid-on, an easy single but England won't mind that
Kemp winds up and drives a half volley to long-off
floated, gentle drive to short extra cover
much the same, well bowled
swept from leg stump, not middled ... not even hit ... and the ball bobbles to short fine leg
driven into the leg side but not into a gap
steps back and mistimed drive back to the bowler
slightly too short but Boucher can't capitalise and hits the ball back to a happy Schofield
pushed into the off side, between the close fielders but no second even though there should have been
on drive past a diving wide mid-on
long hop, mown to long-off ... "horribly" adds Jenny
dropped swatted to deep midwicket, Anderson steaming in gets there but can't hold the chance
dropped flicked to midwicket where Wright drops it a foot or so off the ground diving to his left
and to make Snape feel better Kemp launches that over midwicket for the first six
smashed, just smashed, off the back foot through point sending the dancers into a frenzy
driven out to long-off
down the track, and driven on the move to mid-on
drags it a touch short, cut away - a tad too late on the shot - to point
not so lovely cricket, Schofield dragging short again and a big hoick of a mistimed pull whooshes up short of long-on
steps away to make room and driven up to wide mid-off
dragged short, outside off, and driven on the up over midwicket for a one-bounce four
steps back to make room for a sweet drive out to Schofield at long-off
slower ball, rolling the fingers over it, drops short and wide but nearly gets the wicket, with the fielder getting a fingertip to it at cover
a rare dot, flamingo-whipped - that shot is copyright Pietersen by the way - straight to the man at midwicket
short again, dragged out to the sweeper on the off-side
driven out to midwicket, could have been two; instead he keeps the strike
short and gets away with it as the batsman can only pick out point with the back-foot drive
good bouncer, nipping in off the seam and rising through unexpectedly
low full toss, driven out straight to long-off and only one run is available
good short ball again, similar to the other one earlier this over, Boucher steps back and tries to hook - but isn't too close to the ball
connects this time, but not convincingly, with the drive to short midwicket
full delivery, on off, dug out towards the bowler
a deliberate-looking full toss - but perhaps he didn't mean to bowl it that high all the same - and it's flatbatted to mid-on

I know Kemp hits the ball hard, but this is something else - he's lost a good Mars Bar Kingsize' worth off the bottom of the bat with the drive to long-on. Is Prior's shout to "Get on that" referring to the wood or the ball?
driven up to long-on, Pietersen didn't have to move, three yards inside the boundary
full delivery, defended on the front foot
Schofield saw him coming, aimded at his legs, he could only pat it back
shapes to cut and misses
wheels coming off a touch, here, Pollock shaped to hook, Prior hanging on with ease, not having to move too much to take the ball
and Kemp shows him how it's done with a cover drive for a single
bouncer greets Morkel - he ducks under without alarm
inside edges off the back foot down towards his toes - no danger of rolling towards the sticks
worked out square for a quick single
hard drive to long-off for a quick strike-stealing single

another pull which doesn't come off and skies high. Now, Prior did very well there to make the call in a sea of fielders, and cut right through them to take a difficult catch, leaping forward at the last second
a quick single
worked down off the backfoot wide of third man
a huge strike over midwicket... and over the crowd. That is massive "Into the brewery, full pint!" laughs David Lloyd
worked into the on-side
veering in at leg and despite the misfield at midwicket they settle for one
oh, Flintoff's not at all happy that's been given a wide - a big bouncer, all the same
nips in off the same and is swirled round to midwicket for a comfortable single
moves away, big hook, misses completely
across him this time
driven back straight
backs away and gives himself plenty of room on leg to drive that on the up over extra cover
round the wicket, and a great delivery rounds off the over, up there and on off
driven straight
Collingwood goes for the one over his head, while Shah was running in towards it - it was his catch. Collingwood apologises
flicked to Flintoff at backward point
down on one knee and bashes over midwicket
same again - and same again
goes straight this time - over long-on
the ball pitches outside off; Philander, looking to pull, goes down on one knee and drags an inside edge on to off-stump
driven out to long-off
deliberate full toss, the batsman fends his hands higher and jabs his glove down on it, the ball moving down to gully for a quick single
a very wide outside off - in line with the outside line, in fact and they take the single to boot
on leg and pulled exceptionally hard through square
full and wide, crashes a cut down into the ground
full toss and flatbatted high in the air to Schofield on the long-on boundary who fluffs with one hand, the ball then bounces and moves on to the rope. Broad is a man unamused
veers in towards middle, driven back out to deep extra cover
round the wicket, full and straight, the left hander backs away to carve straight to cover
lovely straight drive hit with immense power to bring the 150 up
Pietersen's misfielding mishaps continue... arriving too late to collect a catch off a straight drive to the deep
driven out to long-on
Snape takes the catch at cover to round off the innings - a decent effort, running round and diving forward, completing the move with a roll
